titleStmt.title: Stand too't Whetston-Park ladies: or; The countrey lasses farewel to sorrow. Maids, here's a caution how to gain rich talents, do, as I've done, keep company with gallants; By which I'm rais'd from mean to high degree, in being to young heirs and gallants free: I fear no colours but will stand it out, the worst can be, is the Covent-Garden-Gout. To the tune of, Never a penny of money.

Stand too't Whetston-Park ladies: or; The countrey lasses farewel to sorrow. Maids, here's a caution how to gain rich talents, do, as I've done, keep company with gallants; By which I'm rais'd from mean to high degree, in being to young heirs and gallants free: I fear no colours but will stand it out, the worst can be, is the Covent-Garden-Gout. To the tune of, Never a penny of money.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, in West-smith-field.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "I am a brave lass, and I travel'd about ..."
Date, place of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
